question.title: how to check multiple variables for 1 condition in java
question.body:
There are multilpe variables inside ValidateBankAccountRequest Object where I have to validate few objects that it should not be null. If one of them is null, throw an error. i tried with the below one. Is there a better way to optimize the same?

  if (v.getEmail().isEmpty() || v.getPrinFirstName().isEmpty() || v.getPrinLastName().isEmpty() || v.getPrinAddrStreet().isEmpty() || v.getPrinAddrCity().isEmpty() || v.getPrinAddrPostalCode().isEmpty()
        ||v.getPrinAddrState().isEmpty()|| v.getPrinAddrCountry().isEmpty() || v.getPrinPhone().isEmpty() || v.getSsn().isEmpty() || v.getDbaName().isEmpty()|| v.getDbaAddrStreet().isEmpty() || v.getDbaAddrCity().isEmpty()
        || v.getDbaAddrPostalCode().isEmpty() || v.getDbaAddrState().isEmpty() || v.getDbaAddrCountry().isEmpty() || v.getDbaPhone().isEmpty() || v.getLglName().isEmpty() || v.getLglAddrStreet().isEmpty() || v.getLglAddrCity().isEmpty() || v.getLglAddrPostalCode().isEmpty()
                || v.getLglAddrState().isEmpty() || v.getLglAddrCountry().isEmpty() || v.getLglPhone().isEmpty() || v.getTaxId().isEmpty()) {
            throw new BadRequestException("BAD_REQUEST");
        }
